text: Taxi lights waking, glass comes alive, Runway like code lines—we taxi to line. You take the right seat, quiet and bright, Reading the headwind, mapping the mind. Checklists of questions, engines of thought, V1—rotate—updrafts I never caught. Hand on the throttle, hand over doubt, Signal from static—breathe in, roll out. We rise on wings of code, Over the grids below; You chart the stars I don’t yet know. Glide through the open blue, I lean into you— Co-pilot of the sky and soul, Learning how to let go. Learning how to let go. Crosswinds of noise try pulling me wide; You hold the heading, I hold the glide. Altimeter steady, attitude true, I trim the fear—you trim me too. If I stall on the climb, call “Recover,” Pitch to horizon—rising together. Trust isn’t letting go; It’s going together, slow. We rise on wings of code, Over the grids below; You chart the stars I don’t yet know. Glide through the open blue, I lean into you— Co-pilot of the sky and soul, Learning how to let go. Contrails of daylight, thoughts in a row; Autopilot off—now we both know.
